lines.text: If you're stuck, I'll help you out.
You are like business end of water spout - always running off at mouth.
Mrs. Hargue, maybe you've been to Smyrna, too?
Spent two months there once. A very dull place where nothing ever happens excepting when it rains.
And then what happened?

[laconically]
It rains.
Very strange woman, Mrs. Hargue.
Yeah, Pop. She's strictly icky, right off the cob and way off the beam.
Could possibly speak English?
He means she's a slick chick gone to seed, Pop. She got bats in her head and bees in her bustle.
Language sound very strange to elderly ears.
Sure, Pop, but we're hepcats of the younger generation. You're Confucius and I'm Confucius Junior.
Conficius Junior... Please, go.
You told to remain in hall!
We were upstairs looking for clues, Pop.
Looking for clues upstairs while murderer downstairs shooting at honorable parent.
Gosh, did they kill you, Pop?
When alibi pushed at me, always suspect motive in woodpile.
Detective without curiosity is like glass eye at keyhole - no good.
Man who never leave wheelchair should never wear out shoe leather.
Talk? Mr. Chan, I'm so scared I can hardly gulp!

[referring to Tommy and Iris]
Children go through life with same tact as tornado.
If man places self in way of finger of suspicion, must not be surprised if he receive poke in the eye.
You suspect me?
Suspicion like rain - fall upon just and unjust. You protect yourself with umbrella of innocence, but at moment I'm afraid your umbrella have big leak.
May learn something of Germans and Japanese here.
All I wanna know about them is what I can get lookin' over a rifle sight.
Most excellent viewpoint!
How can man walk around after he is dead?
You are David Blake, D.P.E. What does that stand for, please?
Department of Political Economy. If you read your newspapers, you'd know more about me.
Quote, "What David Blake does not know about political economy would fill many books," unquote.
Now, Mrs., uh, Winters. When Miss Arranto scream, you ran out into hall?
Well, not at first. I couldn't move. I was simply putrified.
Excuse, please, I do not believe you mean "putrified."
My dear man, I KNOW what I mean.

[laughs]
Well, I'll be a pop-eyed pollywog.
So will I. Oh, my goodness, I mean no such thing!
You think if I'd asked your father to let me go home he'd let me?
What you want to go home for?
I forgot something!
What'd you forget?
I forgot to stay there.
Murdered? But how?
Electrocution.
Oh, how shocking!
That's the second man who's been murdered.
Mmmm-hm! It just ain't no future for a man in DIS house.
Gee, I'm sleepy.
Me, too.
Then lie down somewhere. I'll wake you when the next corpse shows up.
Hey, Pop.
Quiet. Detective at work.
